title: Terrible privacy practices
text:
They first asks for your details and SSN. Then ask you to go to a 3-rd party company to do ID verification. The ID verification company is a noname 2-year old company. So I decided not to proceed, and. Then I went to close my account, and it says by law we need to keep your data for 6 years. Just for trying to sign up, they‚Äôll keep my personal info and SSN for 6 years. Terrible.

Update:
They sent me a useless response. Say upfront that you use a no-name verifier. I didn‚Äôt end up opening my account; why on earth do you need to store my SSN for 6 years??? Fells like you are a part of a foreign spy agency.

title: No fraud protection
text:
I have been a faithful and loyal revolute user for a little over two years. At first I loved it and I swore by it and I told all my friends about it and got my mom to switch over. 

However, my love for this application has taken a sudden change into disgust.

I had four fraudulent charges were not made by me, but from a phishing scam. After 5 hours, and. being transferred to at least four or five different chat agents, despite having recognize the charges as being fraudulent, and me going through all of their security protocols, like changing my passwords and stuff, they are somehow STILL UNEILLING to simply refund these fraudulent charges. 

They told me that I need to go back form within the application itself in order to process it. However, they hace deliberately designed the options/checkboxes on the chargeback form to force you into a loop or we‚Äôre ultimately you are in eligible to receive the chargeback. I know this for a fact, because I just went through every single option available and route you choose to go, all of the sequences of options they make available, and with a final screen, that says ‚Äú we‚Äôre sorry, but you were in eligible to receive a chargeback‚Äù

What‚Äôs even worse is the fact that the chat agents are obviously complicit with their scam. The more and more. Unless they are willing to speak to me. Rather than be helpful and walk me through the process they say one or two things and then disappear for 30 or more. 

This is because I loved Revolut. It was my primary source of daily transfers and transactions.. and to be disappointed such an obvious middle finger, it‚Äôs just garbage.

title: Difficult Interface
text:
Updated after Developer response (thank you)

It took me a while to get around in Revolut, what is obvious to them isn‚Äôt necessarily obvious to a user. Once you know your way around the app and service function as expected. 

Unclear interface and user experience in some important ways, unless you work for Revolut:

For example  I tried to find help about returning funds back to spending from a vault (savings), but they refer to a link that says ‚Äúwithdraw‚Äù under the Vault page. But what they don‚Äôt tell you is that to get there you must:
1. Click on the menu item Vaults
2. Even though you are already there, you must click on your vault again from a list which isn‚Äôt obvious unless you‚Äôve created more than one Vault. 
3. Click on your desired vault, in my case just one. 

Result: after a bit of rabbit holing, you will find the Withdraw link. 

Just an example of ‚Äúdifficulty‚Äù. There are others but trying to keep this short.

title: Not a secure company
text: I‚Äôve had Revolut for over a year. The only reason why I used it was to keep savings in the vault because it had some useful features that other saving accounts don‚Äôt have. Some scammers were able to hack into Revolut‚Äôs official sms service and sent me message telling me to call a number because there was suspicious activity on my account so I did because it was literally the official Revolut sms and there was an ‚Äòagent‚Äô pretending to be a fraud employee at Revolut on the other end. He managed to steal almost every single cent out of my savings.. it was thousands of Euro. Revolut chat team can do NOTHING about it. I was passed around to different agents and none of them were useful. Please don‚Äôt ever put large amounts of money into Revolut and honestly don‚Äôt use it in general. Way to unsafe. How could hackers get into the official sms of Revolut ? UNSAFE

title: Great service for multi-currency needs
text:
I used the app for over 2 years now. 

I purchased the premium subscription service and later they offered at the same price the metal subscription. 

The thing I like most is the ability to do limit orders when exchanging currency. This way I try to get the rate I want and fees are no longer an issue. 

It is great to use the debit card in local currency, although not all merchants seem to accept it. For example in France I am unable to pay for gasoline at the stations, but it works for everything else. 

If you don‚Äôt live in Europe, the service gives you access to SEPA to instantaneously send money to other accounts for free. Great option to send expense money to somebody in Europe. Unfortunately you still can‚Äôt SEPA in your Revolut account as an IBAN is still not available (for residents in the US - I read that this feature should be available for Revolut European customers). 

Crypto is limited since you can‚Äôt withdraw, but it is easy. 

I don‚Äôt have a lot of friends on Revolut so I use other apps to send money. 

Recently, with the Metal service I also tried the feature to purchase passes to Lounges at the airport. There is no discount on the price of the pass, but you can get the pass in most airports and that is great when you have to spend several hours in the airport. 

Adding money to the account was a bit complicated at the beginning because of limits on the system that were not clear and could not be communicated by the support team. Once you get passed that point, it is a great service. 

Overall, very good experience. That I recommend for those that have multi-currency needs. 

There are many other services on the app that I have not used yet so there could be more value for different people.

The subscriptions may look pricey but if you exchange currency often and/or trade crypto, it is pretty easy to recoup the cost‚Ä¶in my opinion. It depends on your case.

Not financial advice, do your own research.

Thanks Revolut!

title: Great for travelers in europe!
text: If you are going on a trip to europe, please get Revolut! Sometimes your travel credit card won't go through and Revolut always will. You can't transfer huge sums of money to your account at once but if you spread it over several weeks, you should have enough to spend on your trip! A great digital debit card with different currencies, and easy way to transfer money between people.
